page.title: 19 CHURCHES
page.content: There is a church and chapel in Rowhedge. The church of{St. Lawrence, is C.of.E. and is{octagonal}in shape, and is said to be modelled on the {Chapter House of York Minster.}The {Mariners' Chapel}was built in 1850 as a Wesleyan Methodist Chapel for the sailors off in their smacks during the winter and crewing the racing yachts in the summer - hence "Mariners". It is now independant Evangelical. {St. {Andrew's}Parish Church stands in Fingringhoe and a Sunday School is held there every Sunday, as well as normal services. There is a bell tower with three bells. Blackheath has a{Baptist Chapel and{St. Mary's}Parish Church stands behind Wivenhoe waterfront.
